peopleAlsoAsk.question: What year gun is considered an antique?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Under the United States Gun Control Act of 1968, any cartridge firearm made in or before 1898 ("pre-1899") is classified as an "antique", and is generally outside of Federal jurisdiction, as administered and enforced by the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (BATFE).
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Antique firearms - Wikipedia

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Is it legal to sell antique guns?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: It isn't illegal to sell any private property you own unless it happens to be an illegal item. That includes firearms. Now to the specifics. Firearms have a very specific age to be called antique, so what you think of as antique may not be.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Does restoring an antique gun lower the value?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Restoring these types of guns can add to their value because it helps return it to its original state â€“ the state that was once prized by its original owner. If the wood fittings or gun stock on an old rifle are damaged, you may want to refinish these to bring them back to their original luster.
